comment: Nicest smartest guy at ksu, one of the hardest classes out there and he teaches it in a way that is doable but he is passionate about it ,leading him to be a tough grader, big outdoorsman so use that to get on a good level with him
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Tudor's class is not easy but he really wants his students to succeed and getting an A is doable. His exams come straight from the textbook, so read and study every chapter to do well. Go to every class because he takes you through every step needed to ace his projects. Go to his office hours too, he is super kind and always willing to help.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment:
Tudor could care less about you, as a student trying to learn and develop for your career. He will tell you to "Google it", and fail you. He relies on TurnItIn as a grading platform, however the questions are flagged for plagiarism and he fails you. 

No lectures, no help, no explanations. ZERO HELP. Guy is collecting a paycheck
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: Very easy summer course. Three open note tests without lockdown. Had very little work and Professor Tudor was very generous when grading. An easy A as long as you attempt.
rating_tags: Group projects--Respected--Online Savvy

comment: Not sure why there are so many bad reviews. He is the best! Took this course online in the summer. Very little work all tests are open note without lockdown :)
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Missing a class is catastrophic. This class moves way to fast and he tries to do a chapter per class by rushing through everything, but never actually finishes the lecture. He relies on you reading the book, and makes the class way more difficult then it has to be; only grades on tests and projects, no cushion points. FIND ANOTHER PROFESSOR!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things

comment: He is one of the rudest professors I have ever dealt with at KSU online. His course is outdated, basically just busy work for a grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers

comment: The ABSOLUTE WORST TEACHER I'VE HAD IN COLLEGE AND I'M A SENIOR. Toughest grader I have ever had.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Abysmal grader and couldnt care less if you failed, his final was two role play activities that completely tanked my grade from a B to a fail
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: The most difficult class of my entire undergrad career, to the point I'm sure it is going to make my GPA take a hit & I literally pray every day that I can just make it out with a C. Quizzes are near impossible despite studying & reading the lecture notes. I read the mixed reviews and thought I could do it, take my advice... Avoid AT ALL COSTS!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: 3 tests, 1 individual project, and 1 group project. Pay attention to the lectures and read the text! The class is pretty hard but its manageable. If you go to his office hours hell explain the material better.

We only had 3 tests, a group project, and an individual project, so there weren't a lot of opportunities to improve your grade. Also, he is a tough grader and doesn't really clarify enough for essay questions on tests. And with the group project... it was horrible. He did not give any direction or help and then criticized each group's project.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Go to his office hours or you will fail his class. This is a hard class and requires you to fully learn SPSS. He does not care if you fail, however he will help you. Do not take him if you want an easy A. He told me that out of all the teachers who teach this class he's the hardest.

This class ruined my GPA. RIDICULOUSLY hard material that makes no sense. Everyone in the GroupMe was constantly confused. He literally does not teach anything. You have to read the textbook, chapter summary, and PowerPoints. I hated this class every single day. Would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Hated this man.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: The worst professor Ive ever had. I was miserable throughout the semester. Two discussions & quiz per chapter WITH CAMERA & LOCKDOWN! He watches the videos & flags papers on TurnItIn. Quizzes are close to impossible. He reads & watches everything. Does not teach at all. Rude, sexist, not helpful at all. Avoid at all costs. HARD GRADER!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: This class was fully 'online', but no online meetings at all. I haven't seen or heard this professor talk ever. This is my 3rd year at KSU and I have never had a worse professor. We had 1 QUIZ due each week and they were lockdown browser w/ camera so we couldn't use our book. Also had 2 discussion questions due each week. Hard Grader DON'T TAKE!

I was nervous for marketing research, but this class was really straightforward! You really only have two major assignments that have really clear instructions and aren't hard to get 100s on. Just make sure to not miss any discussion and quiz deadlines and you'll do great. Quizzes weren't too bad either!
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: Marketing research is a hard class, but he makes it very understandable. Ask as many questions as you need and he won't move on until he knows you've got it. You do have to work for your grade, but an A is very attainable if you take good notes. One of my favorite professors at KSU!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Nice, caring professor. Tests are lockdown with a camera, but if you study the study guides and make a good Quizlet you will pass. Huge project due at the end of the semester and he reads every. single. page of it. Discussion posts due each week and participation matters.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I took him online and did really well. Highly recommend working ahead and picking a strong team for the group project. Your grade comes from module discussions, Exams, Final Exam and a group project. I failed the first exam and asked him for tips and got A's on the rest of the exams and the Final. He's there to help.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: class is not easy. not much is graded so definitely pay attention and try your hardest. Cool professor and great lecturer but grades really tough.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: Look, Market Research is hard regardless. You have to read the book and you have to go to class or you will not do well. So just read and do what you are supposed to do and you'll be ok. There's a group project, MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A GOOD GROUP. If you do not, the class is 100x more difficult. So read and show up and it'll be ok :)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Took him for a summer class so there was only 3 tests that were worth 70% of your grade. You have to read the book, one test was over 8 chapters of material. I understand summer classes are condensed but this class was ridiculous and he does not curve anything. Seriously, pick another professor unless you want to spend all of your time studying.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: The worst professor I have ever had. Quizzes are impossible. Does not take responsibility for mistakes when we makes them. Would not take again
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Some of the classes that I didn't do the best in, I learned the most in & this class is definitely applicable to that statement. Dr. Tudor does not mess around w/ absences or students who don't show initiative. Although coursework is very difficult, he is ALWAYS in his office to assist students and does so with a smile. Seek outside help from him!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: You will have to study hard for the tests. Analysis project is tricky and group project can be frustrating with sub-par group members. But Tudor is a great guy who knows his stuff. He will seem mean off the bat, but he will always take the time to explain things to you and does care. Not easy, but not a bad class. You'll learn
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tudor is a great professor. He has a wealth of knowledge both in teaching and real world experience that he ties into his lectures. He has the unique ability to explain a very complicated subject in terms students can understand and apply. Don't procrastinate is the best advice I can give to anyone deciding to take this class.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you typically want to take an actually organized class.. Don't take this guys class. Worse organization ever. I never knew when due dates were and he grades harder than anyone I've ever had. I was a couple days late for a discussion and he gave me a 0 for lateness and "not linking my citations to the text" when I did. Thanks dude. Awful teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Only online option this semester & next. Exams (6 + final) make up 75 % of total grade, and you only have 45 sec. to read, think, click and save each answer. I  w/d  due to the short time period. Prof's response to request for help showed his lack of concern/interest in helping students succeed. See the dean & share your expr. We deserve better opt
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Tudor is very straight forward. This class was tough, but the professor was always willing to help. He gives students in his class top priority and will allow you to meet with him at anytime. Read the book thoroughly, take notes, and attend every class. Attendance is mandatory, but it is beneficial to the student.

Tudor is nice, clear, and knowledgeable. However, you MUST read the book and MUST study the power points to pass the tests. Project is a lot of work but easy work and really sort of fun. Good class. Good Prof.

You must buy the book and read all the powerpts if you want to pass the tests. This class is no joke. There is a group project and make sure that you choose the right people to be in your group because it is a lot of work and lazy people are not welcomed. The prof is strict, but he knows the material. This is not an easy A, but it is feasable.
Extremely difficult..much more than you need to be.  I think extremely knowledgable, but the hardest class I took.  Needs to lighten up on grading.

I took him for study aboard and he is the worst professor I have ever come across in my four years of college. The highest grade in our class was a 65 and he didn't curve the test leaving one A, couples of B's, and the majority of C's and D's. One would think study aboard would be easy but could you imagne what his real classes are like.
Hard, Hard..You need to know the textbook..Great lectures he knows his stuff but be prepared to study and work hard..
